DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: PEREIRA, E. B.;Enio B. Pereira;Enio Bueno Pereira;Pereira, Enio Bueno;Pereira, E.B.;PEREIRA, ENIO B.;PEREIRA, ENIO

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Й graduado em Fнsica pela Universidade de Sгo Paulo e doutor em Geociкncias pela W. M. Rice University, nos Estados Unidos. Й pesquisador titular sкnior do Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais onde coordena o Laboratуrio de Modelagem e Estudos de Recursos Renovбveis de Energia do Centro de Ciкncias do Sistema Terrestre. Publicou mais de 180 artigos cientнficos nacionais e internacionais e oito livros. Й assessor ad-hoc da FAPESP, CNPq, FAPESB e revisor de vбrias revistas cientнficas nacionais e internacionais. Atualmente concentra suas atividades na бrea de Ciкncias do Sistema Terrestre, com кnfase em estudos de levantamentos de recursos de energias renovбveis e os impactos das mudanзas climбticas. Outras бreas de atuaзгo sгo: sensoriamento remoto da atmosfera, radiaзгo solar, aerossуis e traзadores atmosfйricos e desenvolvimento de instrumentaзгo. Faz parte dos corpos docentes de pуs-graduaзгo em Meteorologia e de Ciкncias do Sistema Terrestre, ambos no INPE. Й lнder de diversos projetos e convкnios de P&D com financiamentos nacionais e internacionais.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: I graduated in physics from the University of Sгo Paulo (1973), received my Master's degree in geophysics from the University of Sгo Paulo (1977), and my Ph.D. in Geosciences from Rice University in the United States (1980). My post-doctorate experience was in the United States and France. I am a former professor and faculty member of the Institute of Astronomy and Geophysics of the University of Sгo Paulo between 1972 and 1981. Between 1984 and 1999 I was involved with the Brazilian Antarctic Program (PROANTAR) and I participated in several missions to the Antarctic, including a wintering mission in 1990. I was also a member of the CONAPA (Committee on Antarctic Research) and a Brazilian delegate in successive meetings of the SCAR (Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research). Currently I am senior researcher at the National Institute for Space Research assigned to various management positions until very recently. My chief research focus is in the area of Earth System Sciences, with emphasis on the assessment of renewable energy resources and their impacts of climate changes. Other areas are: remote sensing of the atmosphere, solar radiation, aerosols, radioactive tracers and pollutants, and instrumentation. I am a faculty member of the graduate programs in Meteorology and Earth System Sciences, both at INPE. I am leader of various national and international projects and research agreements and the head of the research group for Energy and Renewable Resources at the Center of Earth System Sciences.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Short-term forecasting of grid-connected solar photovoltaic generation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The project aims on the enhancement of the capabilities of the partners to use meteorological forecasts for the improvement of the control of renewable energy systems and thus to ease the integration of these technologies to the energy supply schemes of their countries. Building on the experiences of the partners in the field of renewable energy systems, meteorology and metrology in solar and wind energy applications, a comprehensive scheme for an optimized use of meteorological forecast information for system control and thus better grid and system integration should be developed. This should comprise on one hand the combined schemes for the improvement of the numerical weather forecasts by post-processing with the inclusion of space and time information on historic forecast errors, and on the other hand the remaining forecast errors are to be characterized by their distribution function in order to obtain reliable confidence intervals. This information should form the input to schemes for the optimal probabilistic control of the renewable power systems. This is a international cooperation project between Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (Prof. Ricardo Rьther), University of California - San Diego (Prof. Carlos F. M. Coimbra), Solar Energy Research Institute of Singapore - SERIS / National University of Singapore - NUS (Prof. Thomas Reindl and Andre Nobre), Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais - INPE (Prof. Enio B. Pereira and Dr. Fernando R. Martins), and University of Agder / Norway (Prof. Hans-Georg Beyer)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SWERA Solar and Wind Energy Resource Assessment
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto SWERA (Solar and Wind Energy Resource Assessment) tem como objetivo fundamental facilitar a inclusгo de fontes de energia renovбveis na matriz energйtica de paнses em desenvolvimento. Atualmente sгo treze pases envolvidos no projeto divididos em trкs grupos regionai: Бs frica, Amйrica Latina e Бsia. O Centro de Previsгo do Tempo e Estudos Climбticos (CPTEC-INPE) atravйs da Divisгo de Clima e Meio Ambiente (DMA) й responsбvel pela coordenaзгo das atividades do projeto para a Amйrica Latina. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SONDA - Sistema de organizaзгo de dados Ambientais para o setor de energia - Financiamento FINEP
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto SONDA um projeto ligado a бrea de pesquisas em clima e meteorologia, mas com um enfoque direcionado ao suporte de atividades de setor de energia, principalmente as energias renovбveis. O projeto tem como objetivo principal a montagem de um sistema de coleta de dados ambientais de alta confiabilidade que contemple as necessidades dos setores da sociedade envolvidos com a pesquisa, o desenvolvimento, o planejamento e o investimento em uso e aplicaхes de energia renovбveis, principalmente, a energia solar e eуlica. Para isso, foram estabelecidas as seguintes metas: a) implementaзгo de uma rede de coleta de dados meteorolуgicos, ambientais e de recursos solar e eуlicos b) desenvolvimento de uma base de dados que integre informaзхes scio-econфmicas, dados climбtico-ambientais e de disponibilidade de recursos solar e eуlicos c) disponibilizaзгo do acesso а base de dados ao pъblico via website do projeto, de modo que seja possvel a realizaзгo de pesquisas por meio de associaзгo das diversas variбveis disponнveis com a finalidade de produzir informaзхes em conformidade com a necessidade do usбurio d) formaзгo de recursos humanos por meio de treinamento tйcnico e formaзгo acadкmica.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Atmospheric Pattern Studies From a Surface Imager During January 2005 at INPE Southern Regional Center, Sгo Martinho da Serra RS Brazil

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: PEREIRA, E. B.;Enio B. Pereira;Enio Bueno Pereira;Pereira, Enio Bueno;Pereira, E.B.;PEREIRA, ENIO B.;PEREIRA, ENIO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work it is described the analysis of a surface image set obtained at Sгo Martinho da Serra RS, Brazil. The images taken from a surface imager, will be used to establish a criteria to define clear sky and clouds for validation of satellite images. The method used for that purpose is the BAYESIAN in two steps: supervised learning and analysis. Supervised learning will be done by statistics tools and multivariate exploratory data analysis or EDA. Analysis is based on hierarchic priority and multivariate statistics discrimination. By this way, pixel values present on images will be mapped into atmospheric patterns. Only patterns identifiable in visible spectrum and defined by optical and atmospheric physics will be analyzed. Two other methods were also implemented to be compared with the presented method. Complementary to surface images it was obtained solar data of global direct and diffuse radiation from a co-allocated BSRN station. From these sensors it was calculated cloud coverage estimates from surface. To reduce the massive amount of data, they will be split in monthly reports. The current report describes the methods used to calculate data and describes the results relative to January of 2005 with 1659 images.
